text: I’d suggest using the content staging tool for this: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/redesign-and-relaunch-your-site-with-content-staging>

Hey all, I’m pretty sure I’ve run into this before, but anyone know why in VS Code + the HubSpot extension, Emmet will work perfectly within standard HTML template files, but not within `module.html` for any of my modules? Here’s what my `settings.json` looks like:

```{
	"terminal.integrated.defaultProfile.osx": "zsh",
	"editor.suggest.snippetsPreventQuickSuggestions": false,
	"editor.parameterHints": true,
	"emmet.triggerExpansionOnTab": true,
	"emmet.excludeLanguages": ["markdown"],
	"terminal.integrated.inheritEnv": false,
	"tabnine.experimentalAutoImports": true,
	"files.associations": {
		"*.html": "html-hubl",
		"*.css": "css-hubl"
	},
	"emmet.showSuggestionsAsSnippets": true,
	"editor.snippetSuggestions": "top",
	"emmet.includeLanguages": {
		"html-hubl": "html",
		"html-css": "css"
	},
	"editor.defaultFormatter": "esbenp.prettier-vscode",
	"editor.formatOnPaste": true,
	"editor.formatOnSave": true,
	"editor.formatOnType": true,
	"prettier.configPath": ".prettierrc.js",
	"prettier.jsxBracketSameLine": true,
	"prettier.proseWrap": "never",
	"prettier.singleQuote": true,
	"prettier.useTabs": true,
	"window.zoomLevel": -1,
	"html.format.enable": false,
	"HubSpot.beta": true,
}```
Weird I don’t have any issues with emmet in modules. Nor do I really ahve any settings configured for it which dictate languages. Maybe try removing the includeLanguages part?
that broke emmet on the html templates too :confused:
lol. I did. It’s not a huge deal, I just have a `scratch.html` to write my html now and then I copy/paste; just isn’t ideal
Yea I can’t get mine to break adding your emmet configs. Odd
I wonder if something else is conflicting with it?
Tried disabling a few plugins and didn’t have any success either… will need to dig in later when I have some time to work on my environment
Hi all, when I use `hs fetch`  it does not update local files to latest version, I always have to delete all files and re-fetch, is there a flag or something to force update?
Hey Felix! Think you’re looking for the `--overwrite` flag. Should update your local files on fetch.
